member.summary: min/max corners of the box.

member.summary: Addition operator

member.summary: Returns the volume of this

member.summary: Returns the center point of this

member.summary: Returns the eight corners of this.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.Math.LinSolver
member.summary: ABB Internal use only.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.LinSolver.Solve(ABB.Robotics.Math.Matrix,ABB.Robotics.Math.Matrix)
member.summary: Solve a linear equation system using Gaussian elimination.
member.param: Matrix containing coeffiecients for linear eq. system.
member.returns: Solution on success, null on failure.
member.remarks: Uses partial pivoting so should be numerically stable. Not terribly optimized, 100 by 100 matrices is quick (a few ms) but 1000 by 1000 takes some time (a few s).

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.Math.LogicExpression
member.summary: Parses and evaluates a logic (boolean) expression

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.LogicExpression.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an expression without variables, if 'literal' is true. Any non-operators are evaluated by string comparison.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.LogicExpression.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an expression.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.Math.LogicExpression.IsValid
member.summary: Returns True if the expression is valid and can be evaluated

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.Math.LogicExpression.ExpressionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the source expression string

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.Math.LogicExpression.VariableNames
member.summary: Returns the names of variables used in the expression

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.LogicExpression.GetAllowedOperators
member.summary: Returns the allowed operators

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.LogicExpression.SetVariableValue(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the value of a variable, which will be used the next time the expression is evaluated.
member.param: Name of the variable to set

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.LogicExpression.TrySetVariableValue(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the value of a variable, which will be used the next time the expression is evaluated.
member.param: Name of the variable to set
member.returns: True if the variable could be set (i.e. if it exists), false otherwise

member.summary: Evaluates the expression
member.returns: The evaluated value of the expression

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.LogicExpression.BuildRPN
member.summary: Builds an expression in Reverse Polish Notation format
member.returns: True if the RPN expression was successfully generated, False otherwise

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.Math.Globals
member.summary: Contains static constants and utility methods.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Math.Globals.EPS
member.summary: Constant used to compensate for rounding errors.
member.remarks: Always take this into account when comparing a calculated value with a constant (e.g. 1 or -1).

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Math.Globals.MachineEPS
member.summary: Epsilon for comparing single precision values.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Math.Globals.NegativeOneEps
member.summary: Use when comparing a calculated value with -1

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Math.Globals.PositiveOneEps
member.summary: Use when comparing a calculated value with 1

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Globals.AlmostEquals(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Checks if the difference between two numbers is smaller than EPS.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Globals.AlmostEquals(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if the difference between two numbers is smaller than a specified precision.
member.param: The number of decimals to check (max 12)

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Globals.DegToRad(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts degrees to radians.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Globals.RadToDeg(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts radians to degrees.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Globals.Clamp(System.Double)
member.summary: Clamps a value to -1=d=1.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.Math.MathExpression
member.summary: Simple math expression parser and evaluator
member.remarks: Literal values should be using '.' as a decimal separator.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.MathExpression.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new MathExpression class from a mathematical expression

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.MathExpression.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a simple MathExpression from the given value
member.remarks: Calling Evaluate() will return the given value

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.MathExpression.#ctor(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a simple MathExpression from the given value with the specified number of decimals
member.param: Maximum number of decimals to use
member.remarks: Calling Evaluate() will return the given value (rounded to the given number of decimals).

member.summary: This constructor is obsolete.

member.summary: Returns the names of variables used in the expression

member.summary: Returns true if this matrix is rigid (orthogonal), e.g. it represents a pure rotation and translation.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Matrix4.CheckRigid
member.summary: Throws an exception if this matrix is not rigid.

member.summary: Inverts a rigid (pure translation+rotation) matrix.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Matrix4.InverseRigid
member.summary: Returns a an inverted copy of the matrix. If the matrix is non-rigid the result is undefined.

member.summary: Returns true if the matrix is affine.

member.summary: Returns true if the matrix is identity.

member.summary: Inverts a general matrix, using Cramer's rule.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Matrix4.Inverse

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Matrix4.Clean
member.summary: Zeroes any values smaller than Globals.EPS.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Matrix4.CleanRigid
member.summary: Ensures this is a valid rigid matrix

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Matrix4.GetAxisVector(ABB.Robotics.Math.Axis)
member.summary: Gets the axis vector from the specified axis
member.param: the axis whose vector to get

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Matrix4.RelativeMatrix(ABB.Robotics.Math.Matrix4,ABB.Robotics.Math.Matrix4)
member.summary: Returns a matrix representing the relative transform, between the two specified matrices.

member.summary:
Returns a string in the format
[[x.x x.y x.z x.w] [y.x y.y y.z y.w] [z.x z.y z.z z.w] [t.x t.y t.z t.w]]

member.summary: Converts the string representation to its Matrix4 equivalent.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the conversion succeeded

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane
member.summary: Plane, represented by the plane equation nÂ·p+d=0, where n is the normal [x,y,z] and p is any point on the plane.

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.x
member.summary: Plane normal

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.y
member.summary: Plane normal

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.z
member.summary: Plane normal

member.name: F:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.d
member.summary:
Distance from origin.
Negative if the normal points away from the origin, positive if the normal points toward the origin.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a plane from four doubles.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.#ctor(ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a plane from a normal and a distance.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.#ctor(ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3,ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3)
member.summary: Creates a plane from a normal and a point on the plane.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.#ctor(ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3,ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3,ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3)
member.summary:
Creates a plane from three points.
The points are in counterclockwise order seen from in front of the plane.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.#ctor(ABB.Robotics.Math.Matrix4,ABB.Robotics.Math.Axis)
member.summary: Creates a plane from a matrix
member.param: the matrix to create the plane from
Which axis will be the normal of the plane

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.Normal
member.summary: Gets/sets the normal of the plane.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.op_Equality(ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane,ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane)
member.summary: Equality operator

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.op_Inequality(ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane,ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane)
member.summary: Inequality operator

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.Distance(ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3)
member.summary: Returns the distance between the plane and a point.
member.returns: Positive if the point is in front of the plane, negative if it is behind the plane

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.ProjectPoint(ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3)
member.summary: Projects a point onto the plane.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.ProjectVector(ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3)
member.summary: Projects a vector into the plane.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.MirrorPoint(ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3)
member.summary: Mirrors a point in the plane.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.MirrorVector(ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3)
member.summary: Mirrors a vector (direction) in the plane.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.MirrorMatrixKeep(ABB.Robotics.Math.Matrix4,ABB.Robotics.Math.Axis)
member.summary:
Mirrors a coordinate system (represented by a matrix) in the plane and optionally switches two axes to keep the handedness.
The matrix is assumed to be affine.
member.param:
Undefined - Mirror all axes, the handedness of the system will be changed
X - Keep x, switch y and z axes to keep handedness
Y - Keep y, switch x and z axes to keep handedness
Z - Keep z, Switch y and z axes to keep handedness

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.MirrorMatrixFlip(ABB.Robotics.Math.Matrix4,ABB.Robotics.Math.Axis)
member.summary:
Mirrors a coordinate system (represented by a matrix) in the plane and optionally inverts one axis to keep the handedness.
The matrix is assumed to be affine.
member.param:
Undefined - Mirror all axes, the handedness of the system will be changed
X - Invert x axis to keep handedness
Y - Invert y axis to keep handedness
Z - Invert z axis to keep handedness

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.Intersect(ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3,ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3,ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3@)
member.summary: Calculates if and where a straight line between two points intersects the plane.
member.returns: True if the line intersects the plane between point1 and point2.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.Intersect(ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3,ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3,ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Calculates if and where a straight line between two points intersects the plane.
member.param: Returns the parameter value of the intersection point, or NaN if the line is parallel to the plane.
member.returns: True if the line intersects the plane between point1 and point2

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.Angle(ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3,ABB.Robotics.Math.Vector3)
member.summary: Computes the angle between the projection of two vectors onto the plane.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.Math.Plane.ToString
member.summary:
Returns a string in the format
[x y z d]

Gets/sets the rotation as normalized rotation axis and angle

member.summary: Gets/sets the rotation as a 3x3 matrix
